intro: Gerbera petasitifolia, commonly known as the Mexican gerbera, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its botanical characteristics make it a striking addition to both wild and cultivated landscapes.
